alert.note: Alert for Knox; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 4:29PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Laurel and central Knox Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 429 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rossland, or 7 miles northwest of Barbourville, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bentley Station, Emmanuel, Lowell, Garrich and Knoxfork around 435 PM EDT. Barbourville, Baileys Switch, Heidrick, Jarvis, Swanpond, Cranes Nest and Swan Lake around 440 PM EDT. Cannon, Girdler, Boone Heights, Green Road, Artemus and Fount around 445 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Hinkle, Bimble, Yeager, Baughman, Himyar, Brush Creek, Avis, Myrick, Trosper, Barnyard, Old Flat Lick, Hammond, Flat Lick, Dewitt and Salt Gum. THIS INCLUDES U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County between mile markers 1 and 24. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
